section.title: Section 1—Writing Assessment
section.screen:
Section 1—Analytical Writing

2 Questions

60 Minutes

This section of the test consists of two timed writing tasks, analyzing an issue and analyzing an argument. You will have 30 minutes to complete each task.

Click Continue to proceed.

questionGroup.title: Analytical Writing
questionGroup.directions:
Analyzing an Issue

You will be given a brief passage that states or implies an issue of general interest. Instructions will be given on how to respond to the issue. Your response will be graded by how well you:

• respond to the specific task instructions.

• consider the complexities of the issue.

• organize, develop, and express your ideas.

• support your position with relevant reasoning and examples.

• control the elements of standard written English.

Click Continue to proceed.

section.title: Section 1—Writing Assessment

questionGroup.title: Analytical Writing
questionGroup.directions:
Analyzing an Argument

You will be given a brief passage that presents an argument. Instructions will be given on how to respond to the argument. Your response will be graded by how well you:

• respond to the specific task instructions.

• identify and analyze important features of the passage.

• organize, develop, and express your analysis.

• support your position with relevant reasoning and examples.

• control the elements of standard written English.

Click Continue to proceed.

section.end_screen:
You have seen all questions in this section. As long as there is time remaining, you can review your work. Once you leave this section, you WILL NOT be able to return to it.

Click Review to review your answers in this section.

Click Continue to go on to the next section of the test.

section.title: Break
section.screen:
There will be a 60-second pause unless you wish to continue immediately.

The test will continue when the 60-second pause expires.

If you do not want to pause, click Continue.

section.title: Section 2—Verbal Reasoning

questionGroup.title: Sentence Equivalence
questionGroup.directions:
Section 2—Verbal Reasoning

20 Questions

30 Minutes

For each question, choose the best answer using the directions given for each question. If you need more detailed directions, click Help at any time.

If a question has answer choices with ovals, then there is only one correct answer. If a question has answer choices with square boxes, then there may be more than one correct answer. Read the directions for each question carefully.

Click Continue to proceed.

section.end_screen:
You have seen all questions in this section. As long as there is time remaining, you can review your work. Once you leave this section, you WILL NOT be able to return to it.

Click Review to review your answers in this section.

Click Continue to go on to the next section of the test.
